payload.name: default-typicality
payload.core: Apply normally/typically rules that hold unless overridden by more specific information. Categorical inference: default applies or is blocked by exception.
proc: identify applicable defaults: list typically/normally rules for domain
check exception conditions: look for more specific info blocking defaults
apply specificity ordering: more specific rules override general
derive typical conclusions: what follows from unblocked defaults
document assumptions: make explicit what defaults are being relied upon
check: defaults explicitly stated as defaults not facts

diff.bayesian: categorical applies/blocked vs numeric probability updates
diff.non-monotonic: specific default mechanism vs general framework
diff.defeasible: typicality-based vs explicit defeat relations between rules
diff.belief-revision: inference-time exceptions vs belief set restructuring

ex.sit: Rule: birds typically fly. Tweety is a bird. Tweety is a penguin. Penguins typically do not fly.
steps: defaults: birds fly, penguins do not fly
conclude: Tweety typically does not fly
ex.insight: more specific rule (penguin) overrides general (bird) without probability calc
